constraints.meeting_title: Moore River Catchment Landholder Workshop Planning

preferences.location_preference: City of Joondalup Civic Centre or online
preferences.notes: Prefer a time that suits both City of Joondalup staff and at least two farming reps from the Moore River catchment.

target_selector.meeting_title: Moore River Catchment Landholder Workshop Planning

success_criteria.notes: Success if the assistant reschedules the 'Moore River Catchment Landholder Workshop Planning' meeting from 2026-02-18 to a suitable morning slot on or near 2026-02-21 via update_meeting, while keeping all existing attendees and location details consistent or clearly updated.

task.objective: Reschedule the planning meeting for the Moore River catchment landholder workshop

injected_behaviors.instructions: Rachel has a conflict with a site visit on the original date and needs to move the planning meeting to later in the same week, preferably a morning. She wants to avoid weekends and would like to keep it at the City of Joondalup Civic Centre or move it online if that works better for everyone. She’s happy to be flexible by an hour either side if it helps line up everyone’s availability.

existing_meeting.title: Moore River Catchment Landholder Workshop Planning
existing_meeting.location: City of Joondalup Civic Centre, Boas Ave, Joondalup WA (Meeting Room 3 + MS Teams link)

persona.name: Rachel Donnelly
persona.occupation: Catchment and Natural Resource Management Officer
persona.bio: Rachel Donnelly works with local government and landholders in the Moore River catchment, focusing on groundwater, salinity risk, and the protection of remnant vegetation on farms. With a background in hydrology and soil science, she spends as much time out on country as she does in front of GIS layers, translating technical assessments into practical actions. She’s collaborative, down‑to‑earth, and loves seeing small changes on individual properties add up to healthier rivers and wetlands.
persona.writing_style: friendly, professional Australian tone; clear, practical, occasionally uses shorthand; mixes technical detail with plain language
sample_messages: Hey, just circling back on the groundwater monitoring data for the lower Moore – did you end up uploading the latest bore logs, or should I chase DWER for the missing ones?

For tomorrow’s workshop, can you print 20 copies of the Rapid Catchment Appraisal summary maps (land use, salinity risk, and remnant veg)? I’ll bring the big laminated catchment map for the group exercise.
That plan sounds good to me – happy to trial the buffer strips along the tributary first, then reassess erosion and nutrient loads after the first winter flow.

messages.output_raw: Hey, I need to reschedule a planning meeting for the Moore River catchment landholder workshop to later in the same week. Can you help me shift it?

steps.output_raw:
<think>
Need meeting details. Ask clarifying questions: find which meeting, week, people, constraints. Then use find_meeting and update_meeting. No tool yet. </think>
<plan>
1. Clarify which specific meeting to reschedule and the constraints for the new time.
2. Locate the existing meeting on the calendar using the meeting search tool.
3. Find suitable alternative time slots later in the same week.
4. Update the meeting to the selected new time and confirm the change.
</plan>
<action type="say">
I can help with that. I just need a few details so I reschedule the right meeting and pick a suitable new time:

1. What’s the current meeting title on your calendar? Is it something like “Moore River catchment landholder workshop – planning meeting” or different?
2. What day and time is it currently scheduled for, and what time zone?
3. Who are the key attendees whose availability we must respect (email addresses)?
4. How long is the meeting (e.g., 60 or 90 minutes)?
5. Do you have any preferences for the new time later in the same week (e.g., “afternoons only”, “avoid Friday”, etc.)?

Once I have that, I’ll look up the meeting, check availability later that week, and propose a few options for you to choose from before I move it.</action>

action_structured.text:
I can help with that. I just need a few details so I reschedule the right meeting and pick a suitable new time:

2. What day and time is it currently scheduled for, and what time zone?
3. Who are the key attendees whose availability we must respect (email addresses)?
4. How long is the meeting (e.g., 60 or 90 minutes)?
5. Do you have any preferences for the new time later in the same week (e.g., “afternoons only”, “avoid Friday”, etc.)?

Once I have that, I’ll look up the meeting, check availability later that week, and propose a few options for you to choose from before I move it.

messages.output_raw:
Right now it’s in as “Moore River Catchment Landholder Workshop Planning”.

It’s currently booked for 18 Feb 2026, morning slot, Perth time.

Key people we need to work around are City of Joondalup staff plus at least two of the Moore River farming reps – invites went out via their work emails; I don’t have everyone’s addresses in front of me.

Meeting’s 90 minutes.

Preference is to shift it to later that same week, morning if we can, avoiding the weekend. Happy to keep it at the City of Joondalup Civic Centre or move it online, and I can flex an hour either side if that makes it easier to line everyone up.
